# Methods

## Data analysis

All baseline demographic and clinical variables were described as means Â± standard deviations if continuous and as group-specific frequencies if categorical. A series of independent samples t tests with Welch's approximation to the degrees of freedom was used to test the hypothesis of zero between-group difference in means of continuous variables (age, years of education and device energy). A series of Pearson's $\chi^2$ test was used to test the hypothesis that randomization group and each categorical variable (sex, diagnosis, study completion, termination phase and medication types) are independent of each other.
